title: 'Horrific': US slams mob violence on Hindu worker in Bangladesh; demands action

The incident highlights the precarious situation for religious minorities amid political shifts.

His legacy of innovation, trust, and nation-building continues to inspire.

title: Decoded: Barron Trump's friendship with Andrew Tate
description: The focus on Barron Trump followed reporting that he had been in contact with Justin Waller, a Texas-based influencer who presents himself as a close confidant of Andrew and Tristan Tate. Waller has described himself as a “third brother” to the Tates, a phrase meant to signal loyalty rather than family ties. According to his own accounts, he has socialised with Barron and spoken to him regularly, including on personal matters such as dating and navigating public life.

title: Will Earth really switch to 25 hours days as its rotation slowing down
description: Earth's days are slowly getting longer. This change is driven by the Moon's gravity and shifts in Earth's mass due to melting ice and rising seas. Scientists use advanced tools to measure these tiny shifts. A 25-hour day is a distant future event, taking millions of years. The current changes are imperceptible.

title: Indian students placing their bets on destinations beyond the Big 4: Here’s why
description: Indian students are still looking abroad, but they are choosing differently. The US, UK, Canada and Australia now come with higher costs, stricter visa checks and too many unknowns. So many are turning to places that feel more workable—Germany for affordability, New Zealand for stability, and the UAE for proximity and job links. It is study abroad, with fewer surprises.

description: In this year ender episode of Decode Karnataka, an annual tradition of sorts, we take stock of the events and developments that made news in 2025.

title: Rowdy-sheeter externed from district
description: SP, District Collector Dr. A. Siri issued orders externing Tulasi Kumar from the district. Tulasi Kumar’s father, Vadde Ramanjaneyulu, and another rowdy-sheeter, Pathan Imran Khan, were also externed from the district a few days ago

title: AirPods experiment: Apple tested two colours and then dropped them; here’s why
description: New leaks reveal Apple experimented with bright pink and yellow AirPods charging cases in 2016, abandoning them for the iconic white design. This follows previous reports of other color explorations. The recently launched AirPods Pro 3, however, introduce significant upgrades including a heart rate sensor and improved noise cancellation.

title: How the Aravalli Hills formed and why they look the way they do
description: The Hills’ features are better understood as part of a belt of ancient rocks that many scholars have called the Aravalli-Delhi orogenic belt

title: Watch: Men in high-speed cars perform deadly stunts; Delhi Police responds
description: A group of men was captured on video performing reckless stunts and high-speed racing on Delhi streets, swerving through traffic and standing out of car sunroofs. The footage, shared widely on social media, prompted a response from Delhi Police, who have been informed and are verifying the video to identify the individuals involved.

title: Pakistan kabaddi player wears Indian jersey, waves tricolour; banned indefinitely
description: Pakistan international kabaddi player Ubaidullah Rajput has been indefinitely banned by the Pakistan Kabaddi Federation for playing for an Indian team in a private tournament in Bahrain without a no-objection certificate. Rajput claimed it was a misunderstanding, but the federation cited his participation and representation of an Indian team as violations.

title: Mann Ki Baat: PM Modi reflects on India’s milestones in 2025
description: ‘From national security to the sports field, from science laboratories to the world’s biggest platforms, India left a strong mark everywhere,’ Modi said during the year-ending ‘Mann Ki Baat’ episode

title: President Murmu takes submarine sortie at Karwar naval base - see pics
description: President Droupadi Murmu experienced a submarine sortie aboard the INS Vaghsheer, an indigenous Kalvari class submarine, at the Karwar naval base. Accompanied by Chief of Naval Staff Admiral Dinesh K. Tripathi, this marks the second presidential submarine journey, following APJ Abdul Kalam.

title: Indian-origin techie who helped Apple fight terrorism quits to build startup
Digvijay's remark on X open dissent against Congress, Rahul dooming party: BJP

description: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor offered a measured response to Digvijaya Singh's praise for the RSS's organizational strength, emphasizing the need for internal discipline. While acknowledging Singh as a friend, Tharoor stated the party can learn from its own 140-year history. Other Congress leaders sharply criticized the RSS, highlighting ideological differences.

How B'luru techie became Andhra’s ‘lady don’; arrested for supplying 'Sheelavathi strain'
description: Nathavaram police have arrested eight individuals, including a Bengaluru software engineer, for smuggling high-quality Sheelavathi strain cannabis from Narsipatnam to Tamil Nadu and Sri Lanka. The operation, led by 'lady don' Gade Renuka, involved procuring ganja from Odisha and distributing it, marking a potential first for smuggling to Sri Lanka via the Andhra-Odisha border.

description: Myanmar is holding its first general election since the 2021 military coup, which the junta claims restores democracy. With major opposition parties banned and leaders jailed, the election is highly contentious, lacking genuine competition and free expression.

Offensive songs and slogans are banned, and security measures including screening and fire safety are compulsory.

The year concluded with mixed stock market trends,  record FIIs, rupee pressure and tariffs highlighting ongoing global uncertainties.
